body_html:
1. if you use the pytorch binaries, we ship cudnn6 in them, use it it's great.
  2. cudnn 5.1.10 maybe has a bug. cc: @ngimel . @gongbudaizhe do you have a small test case to reproduce this?
  3. TensorFlow does not use CuDNN batchnorm by default, so maybe that's why?
body_text:
if you use the pytorch binaries, we ship cudnn6 in them, use it it's great.
cudnn 5.1.10 maybe has a bug. cc: @ngimel . @gongbudaizhe do you have a small test case to reproduce this?
TensorFlow does not use CuDNN batchnorm by default, so maybe that's why?
body:
1. if you use the pytorch binaries, we ship cudnn6 in them, use it it's great.
2. cudnn 5.1.10 maybe has a bug. cc: @ngimel . @gongbudaizhe do you have a small test case to reproduce this?
3. TensorFlow does not use CuDNN batchnorm by default, so maybe that's why?
